sub_title: Legal Counsel and Board Member of Ferrovial Airports International.
summary:
Corporate and M&A lawyer specialised in M&A, Corporate and Commercial law issues and P3s in international projects. I have advised from leading law firms Spanish listed Companies and multinational groups in projects all around the world. More than 20 years of experience.

I am now Legal Counsel and Board Member of Ferrovial Airports International, (head of the Ferrovial Airports and Vertiports division, owning and managing its portfolio, including the largest shareholding in Heathrow, Aberdeen, Glasgow and Southampton Airports in the UK, the New Terminal One at JFK New York Airport in the US and Dalaman International Airport in Turkey, development of vertiports in the US and transmission lines in Chile). 

Legal Counsel of JFK NewTerminalOne LLC (concessionaire of the development and operation of the New Terminal One, the largest international terminal at JFK Airport in New York and the leading P3 Airport Project in the US). Ferrovial Airports is the leading shareholder of the concessionaire, participated also by JLC, Ullico and Carlyle. 

Also Board member and Legal Counsel until 2020 of Denver Great Hall LLC (concessionaire of the Great Hall of Denver International Airport, the 6th busiest airport in the US). 

My field of expertise includes: 

- Corporate and M&A matters. Extensive track record in M&A in different sectors (infra, energy, utilities, retail, banking, etc.) and geographies (Europe, US, LatAm). M&A disputes and ICC arbitration.

- Infrastructure projects, concessions and P3 structures (focused during the last years in North America).

- Board Member of several companies, actively involved in asset management and committed to add value to Boards with expertise in oversight, governance, ESG and M&A experience combined with a detailed understanding of the business. Focused as Board member on compliance, governance and creating long-term value for shareholders and always interested in ESG and innovation towards mobility, sustainability and decarbonization.

- Coordination of the legal advice and strategy to leading listed infrastructure companies, financial investors and private equity funds in international projects (US, UK, Spain, France, Germany, Austria, Brazil, Chile, etc.) 

Regularly invited as lecturer on Commercial law and M&A aspects in leading law schools  (ICADE, Universidad Carlos III or IEB).

I regularly do pro-bono work.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible of legal matters and Board member of Ferrovial Airports International (head company of the Ferrovial Airports and Vertiports business, owner of their assets, including the largest shareholding in Heathrow, Aberdeen, Glasgow and Southampton Airports in the UK, the New Terminal One at JFK New York Airport in the US and Dalaman International Airport in Turkey. 

In addition to asset management, M&A, bidding and Board oversight, I continue, as General Counsel for North America, in charge of legal aspects and contractual strategy of business projects and development in North America, including  JFK New Terminal One LLC (concessionaire of the development and operation of the new Terminal One, the largest international terminal at JFK Airport in New York)

Board Member of Ferrovial Airports International and Denver Great Hall LLC (concessionaire of the Great Hall of Denver International Airport, the 6th busiest airport in the US).

Development of US Vertiports

profile_positions.description:
After several years advising leading companies on M&A transactions and international strategies from a leading international law firm, I opened my own firm specialised on M&A, Corporate, Contractual and Commercial law issues and focused on a number of strategic infrastructure clients; I focused my advice on acting as legal counsel and trust advisor for some of the leading listed Spanish infrastructure groups in their strategic projects abroad. 

My firm advised Companies and investors in their transactions in Spain and I coordinated the legal strategy for some Spanish leading Companies included in the IBEX 35 in some of their main assets and infrastructure projects in foreign jurisdictions (US, Austria and France). 

My regular advice included corporate, contractual and corporate matters on international projects. This advice included drafting of MoU and Letters of Intent, acquisition agreements, shareholders agreements, post-completion work, price adjustments and warranties´ claims, etc. 

My firm led the advice on the sale by a Spanish listed Infrastructure Group of a European energy division with assets in different European countries (approx.value: EUR 100M). 

I represented one of the leading Spanish listed Companies as shareholder in one of the largest insolvency proceedings in Europe. 

I led strategic legal advice on an ICC arbitration abroad and related settlement and advised on international agreements and joint ventures, as well as construction, engineering and FIDIC agreements, etc. 

I advised Spanish Companies on legal structures to grow in the US and other American countries through P3 Projects, optimising the financing needed for this purpose. 

I continued involved in pro-bono work and advice to clients on CSR matters.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
Senior Lawyer on M&A, Corporate and Commercial law issues with clients from all around the world. 

During these years, I have advised some of the leading private equity funds and Spanish leading Companies (including several of the Spanish listed Companies included in the IBEX 35) in some of their main projects in Spain and abroad (Portugal, Italy, US, Austria and France, among other jurisdictions),.

During 2007, and after competing with other firms, I was chosen for a full time secondment program to lead the legal counselling for new projects in Italy and Portugal of one of the major European construction and infrastructures listed Companies. 

I spent almost a year leading the legal advice on several Italian and Portuguese State Concessions for running of infrastructures, which involved complex public & regulatory law, finance and corporate law aspects. Once we selected and established an in-house team with three lawyers I continued with my work at Baker & McKenzie.

As head of an M&A team, during these years I coordinated and led M&A advice to some of the leading Spanish Companies and foreign groups operating in Spain (corporate, contractual and corporate matters on international projects). My advice included negotiating all M&A phases: drafting of MoU and Letters of Intent, engagement letters with investment banks, due diligence review, acquisition agreements, shareholders agreements, option agreements, post-completion work, price adjustments and warranties´ claims, etc.).  

I was also asked by clients to cooperate with the Government in the drafting of new legislation and I have worked together with the Spanish Justice Department on the drafting of bills affecting specific sectors and organisations.

I contributed to launch the Baker & McKenzie CSR Committee and activities in Spain.
